newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony unit sees 97/98 game shipments at 18 mln.
newsitem.headline: Sony unit sees 97/98 game shipments at 18 mln.

text.p: Sony Computer Entertainment Inc said on Thursday that it expects to ship 18 million units of its game console PlayStation in the global market in 1997/98.
A company spokesman declined to disclose total shipments in 1996/97.
The Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Thursday that the company, Sony Corp's game unit, shipped 8.98 million units in 1996/97.
The company also said that its net sales of game machines and software would reach 650 billion yen in 1997/98, up from an estimated 400 billion yen in 1996/97.
As of the end of March 1997, the company had shipped a total of 13.5 million PlayStations since it first introduced the game machine in December 1994.
